sentence.Network_en: Mobutu ascended through the ranks, eventually becoming commander of the army.
sentence.Network_cn: 蒙博托出身行伍，通过一级级晋升，最终成为了陆军司令。

sentence.Network_en: He could not escape the massed ranks of newsmen.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没法躲开成群的记者。

sentence.Network_en: Last month, 370,000 Americans joined the ranks of the unemployed.
sentence.Network_cn: 上个月，有37万美国人加入了失业者的行列。

people of all ranks and classes ., 各阶级各阶层人民.

排名算法（ranking algorithm）（Ranking algorithm）是搜索引擎用来对其索引中的列表进行评估和排名的规则。排名算法（ranking algorithm）决定哪些结果是与特定查询相关的。
名列前茅（TopRank）即搜索结果优先排名，同时包括关键词搜索结果和产品目录搜索结果的优先排名。推广客户购买以后，其产品 …

entry.def: Someone's rank is the position or grade that they have in an organization.

example.ex: He eventually rose to the rank of captain...
example.tran: 他终于升职当上了船长。

example.ex: The former head of counter-intelligence had been stripped of his rank and privileges.
example.tran: 反情报机构的前任长官被革职并剥夺了特权。

entry.tran: （尤指社会地位高的）阶级，地位
entry.def: Someone's rank is the social class, especially the high social class, that they belong to.

example.ex: Each rank of the peerage was represented...
example.tran: 每个贵族阶级都有代表。

example.ex: He must be treated as a hostage of high rank, not as a common prisoner.
example.tran: 必须把他当成高级人质来对待，而不能像对待普通囚犯那样。

entry.def: If an official organization ranks someone or something 1st, 5th, or 50th, for example, they calculate that the person or thing has that position on a scale. You can also say that someone or something ranks 1st, 5th, or 50th, for example.

example.ex: The report ranks the UK 20th out of 22 advanced nations...
example.tran: 报告中把英国排在22个先进国家中的第20位。

example.ex: He was at the time ranked 10th in the world and had a regular place in the Swedish Davis Cup team...
example.tran: 他那时世界排名第10，并且是瑞典戴维斯杯队的主力队员。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something ranks high or low on a scale or if you rank them high or low, you are saying how good or important you think they are.

example.ex: His prices rank high among those of other contemporary photographers...
example.tran: 在当代摄影师当中，他的要价很高。

example.ex: Investors ranked South Korea high among Asian nations...
example.tran: 在亚洲各国当中，投资者很看重韩国。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something ranks with a group of famous people or things, you mean that they are extremely good and should be included in that group.

example.ex: ...a performance of heroic calibre that must rank with the most memorable in international rugby...
example.tran: 必被列为国际橄榄球赛中最令人难忘的一场荡气回肠的比赛

example.ex: As a novel, Nineteen Eighty-four hardly ranks with the greats.
example.tran: 作为一部小说，《一九八四》很难被列为杰作。

entry.tran: （团体或组织的）全体成员;队伍
entry.def: The ranks of a group or organization are the people who belong to it.

example.ex: There were some misgivings within the ranks of the media too...
example.tran: 媒体内部也存在一些疑虑。

example.ex: The General Assembly welcomed five new members to its ranks.
example.tran: 联合国大会对5个新成员国的加入表示了欢迎。

entry.tran: 普通成员；（尤指军队的）普通士兵
entry.def: The ranks are the ordinary members of an organization, especially of the armed forces.

example.ex: Top military leaders say there have been reports of demoralization in the ranks...
example.tran: 最高军事指挥说有报告称士兵中出现了士气低落。

example.ex: Most store managers have worked their way up through the ranks.
example.tran: 大多数商店经理都是由普通店员干起，一步步升上来的。

entry.def: A rank of people or things is a row of them.

example.ex: Ranks of police in riot gear stood nervously by...
example.tran: 一队队防暴警察紧张待命。

example.ex: She continued to smile at the ranks of cameras on their doorstep.
example.tran: 她依旧对着门口的一排排照相机微笑着。

entry.def: A taxi rank is a place on a city street where taxis park when they are available for hire.

example.ex: The man led the way to the taxi rank...
example.tran: 那人带路来到了出租汽车候客处。

example.ex: He walked towards the first taxi on the rank.
example.tran: 他朝着停车处的第一辆出租车走去。

entry.def: You can use rank to emphasize a bad or undesirable quality that exists in an extreme form.

example.ex: He called it 'rank hypocrisy' that the government was now promoting equal rights.
example.tran: 他把目前政府提倡平等权利的举措称为“彻头彻尾的伪善”。

entry.tran: 臭气难闻的；（气味）令人恶心的
entry.def: You can describe something as rank when it has a strong and unpleasant smell.

example.ex: The kitchen was rank with the smell of drying uniforms.
example.tran: 厨房内充斥着烘干制服的难闻气味。

example.ex: ...the rank smell of unwashed clothes.
example.tran: 脏衣服所发出的臭味

entry.tran: （队伍、组织的成员等）违反指令，抗命
entry.def: If you say that a member of a group or organization breaks ranks, you mean that they disobey the instructions of their group or organization.

example.ex: 'Even the President's staunchest supporters have some issues where they simply must break ranks,' says Senator Lott...
example.tran: “即使是总统最忠实的拥护者在某些事情上也会不听指令，”参议员洛特说。

example.ex: Britain appears unlikely to break ranks with other members of the European Union.
example.tran: 英国看起来不会与欧盟的其他成员反目。

entry.tran: （在受到批评时）捐弃嫌隙而携手合作，抱成一团
entry.def: If you say that the members of a group close ranks, you mean that they are supporting each other only because their group is being criticized.

example.ex: Conservative MPs intend to put aside their differences over Europe and close ranks behind the Prime Minister...
example.tran: 保守党下院议员打算暂且搁置他们在欧洲问题上的分歧，团结起来支持首相。

example.ex: Institutions tend to close ranks when a member has been accused of misconduct.
example.tran: 当其中某成员被谴责失职时，机构往往会抱成一团。

entry.tran: 步…后尘；经历（他人）曾经历过的（尤指坏事）
entry.def: If you experience something, usually something bad, that other people have experienced, you can say that you have joined their ranks .

example.ex: Last month, 370,000 Americans joined the ranks of the unemployed...
example.tran: 上个月，有37万美国人加入了失业者的行列。

entry.tran: 成功可能性不大的参赛者
entry.def: If one of the people in a competition is described as a rank outsider, they are considered to have very little chance of winning.

example.ex: The rank outsiders, Cameroon, beat the defending champions, Argentina, by one goal to nil.
example.tran: 本不被看好的喀麦隆队却以1比0击败了卫冕冠军阿根廷队。

entry.tran: 运用职权，滥用权力（压制他人）
entry.def: If you say that someone in authority pulls rank, you mean that they unfairly force other people to do what they want because of their higher rank or position.

example.ex: The Captain pulled rank and made his sergeant row the entire way.
example.tran: 上校倚仗权势让他的中士划船划了一路。

auth_sentence.content: He says that no bank has totally broken ranks.
auth_sentence.res_content: He says that no bank has totally broken ranks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He says that no bank has totally broken ranks.

auth_sentence.content: Some fine green shoots are coming through the ranks.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some fine green shoots are coming through the ranks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some fine green shoots are coming through the ranks.

auth_sentence.content: How about applications in government, corporate executive ranks?
auth_sentence.res_content: How about applications in government, corporate executive ranks?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How about applications in government, corporate executive ranks?

Sentence.sentence: A recent Chinese survey ranks 35 American universities among the top 50, eight among the top 10.
